column4: hi where is that startup file where you disable/enable things?
i think NM is disable here but i forgot where to re enable it
also once i add a mobile broadband info, how do i dial up?
/etc/init.d/*
i see the option connect autopmaticalluy
or use sysv-rc-conf
is there any command?
like chkconfig NetworkManager start or soemthing
what are you on about? a network connection starting autoamticallY?
ok what i mean is, now NM is disabled on startup, i want to use it with my vodafone mobile connect activated phone, so i want to re-enable it at startup but forgot where to do so
in networkmanager
right-click on it - edit connections
NM doesnt run on startup :P
its disabled
does NM does not start or only NM-applet
possibly NM-applet
lauch from console: nm-applet
and if it is NM itself?
if nm-applet starts and you can use-it just add it to your gnome-sessions
if it starts but it says NetworkManager is not running
then use sysv-rc-conf to enable NetworkManager on init 3
